borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<div>The scale, siting, bulk and design of the proposed development would unbalance the symmetry of the semi-detached pair and appear visually obtrusive, representing a significant addition to the original floorspace of the dwelling. This would cause harm to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area.&nbsp; As such, the proposed development is contrary to the following policies which promote good design that respects and reflects the character of the original dwelling and local area:</div><div><br></div><div><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
National Planning Policy Framework </span>National Planning Policy Framework
(NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy D4 of the
London Plan (March 2021)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy
CP3 of the </span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
Policies BP8 and BP11 of the </span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough
Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- The Residential
Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal">









</p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of </span>The London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p><p><br></p></div>

<p>The proposed development would constitute the conversion of a 3-bedroom family home into 5 separate units. This represents the loss of a family home, contrary to the following policies which seek to preserve the borough's stock of family homes:</p><p>Policy CC1 of&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010) </p><p>Policy DMH4 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p><p>Policy BC4&nbsp;of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</p>

<div>The scale, siting and design of the proposed development would result in an overbearing impact and a harmful loss of outlook and daylight to 4 Upney Lane, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to the following policies which seek to protect the residential amenity of neighbouring dwellings:</div><div><br></div><div><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
National Planning Policy Framework </span>National Planning Policy Framework
(NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy
D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span><o:p></o:p></p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy
CP3 of </span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
Policies BP8 and BP11 of the </span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough
Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- The Residential
Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal">









</p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of </span>The London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p><p><br></p></div>
description: Construction of a first floor side and rear extension and alterations to the ground floor plan.  Construction of a rear dormer extension including two roof lights to the front.
